alert.note: Alert for Southampton; Surry; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 7:16PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Southampton, eastern Sussex and southwestern Surry Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dendron, or near Wakefield, moving southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waverly, Courtland, Wakefield, Ivor, Newsoms, Dendron, Homeville, Elberon, Sedley, Capron, Vicksville, Booth Fork, Carsley, Berlin, Yale, Lumberton, Ellis Fork, Manry, Worrell and Littleton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.
